talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: I own two Corgis who are incredibly friendly and well behaved and I feel guilty when they slip out of our fence in our tiny neighborhood, I literally cannot understand the people who are like 'my Rot just wanders around sometimes'

talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: They really are. Ours are named Peanut Butter and Jelly and they're dorks. Peanut is at my feet right now, Jelly is laying next to the loveliwife

talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: They really are. Ours are named Peanut Butter and Jelly and they're dorks. Peanut is at my feet right now, Jelly is laying next to the loveliwife

talk.author: did:plc:y6yjdfkftcn3phwvp5kzser3
talk.utter: “Oh I’m a corgi, look I don’t have any legs!”

talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: Interestingly, not the result of the selective breeding of the 19th century like a lot of other breeds!

talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: I'm sure, like Aussies and Poodles, they -can- be very nice and loving dogs. Its a very pretty animal! But like dogs have needs and working dogs have working needs and letting it sit in your house dreaming of work to do is abusing the animal and makes it my problem more than yours

talk.author: did:plc:nmm26ltnxjx4oskwzdue4xvq
talk.utter: I had one. We did Frisbee and agility training with her. I also taught her to "seek" where i would hide an object and she'd have to sniff it out as a way to keep her engaged when the weather was bad. Our vet said she was the only Malinois they liked seeing, lol

talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: Yeah working dogs are great if you do stuff like that. My aunt has an Aussie and does all of that. Great dog. Wears her and himself out doing all sorts of shit, but that's what you have to do with these animals. Its a big investment, they're not hound dogs just laying around

talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: Yeah working dogs are great if you do stuff like that. My aunt has an Aussie and does all of that. Great dog. Wears her and himself out doing all sorts of shit, but that's what you have to do with these animals. Its a big investment, they're not hound dogs just laying around

talk.author: did:plc:qiknc4t5rq7yngvz7g4aezq7
talk.utter: also many working-line hound dogs are just as bad energy wise

talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: Its true! Activity level is something people need to pay -way- more attention to

talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: The economics at a Michelin two star restaurant are different than at a Applebees and if they want to charge double at such a place that's fine and probably appropriate to their economics

talk.author: did:plc:levwf7vkqlubovve5j25ydjt
talk.utter: Yes, but they need to CLEARLY post it at the door so I can move along. I'm on a budget! (Then again: doubtful I would ever eat at one of those places)

talk.author: did:plc:bhg5fzu5fgj57tqsgsxc2ki2
talk.utter: If you're eating at a Michelin two star place you're not being cost sensitive in that moment, is my argument
